Yes, there are several festivals and events in Shillong that coincide with the trekking season. Some of the popular ones include:

1. Shillong Autumn Festival: This festival is held in October-November and celebrates the harvest season. Tourists can expect cultural performances, traditional food, and handicraft exhibitions.

2. Cherry Blossom Festival: Held in November-December, this festival celebrates the blooming of cherry blossoms in Shillong. There are cultural shows, food stalls, and art exhibitions during this festival.

3. Nongkhnum River Festival: This festival is held in December-January and celebrates the river ecosystem of Shillong. Tourists can expect kayaking, fishing, and boat races, as well as cultural performances and food stalls.

4. Shad Suk Mynsiem: This is a traditional festival held in April-May and celebrates the harvest season. Tourists can expect traditional dances, music, and rituals during this festival.

Overall, tourists can expect vibrant cultural celebrations, delicious food, and unique experiences during these festivals in Shillong.
